turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about East Bay Ray.
turn.1: What happened in East Bay Ray's early years?
turn.2: However, earlier in their career, Biafra, along with the other band members, approved the use of Dead Kennedys' songs in the major film corporation releases "Neighbors" (1981), and "Class" (1983).
turn.3: What other things did they do?
turn.4: Fairly recently, Biafra himself approved the license to Tony Hawk's video game (May 5, 1999 Fax from Uli Elser, previous manager of Alternative Tentacles).
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Ray was a featured artist in the April 2006 edition of "Guitar Player" magazine talking about recording production techniques and in the January 2006 issue of "Guitar World".
turn.7: What other techniques did he use?
turn.8: Ray guests on the track "Guitar Hero" on The Dresden Dolls lead singer/pianist Amanda Palmer's solo debut, "Who Killed Amanda Palmer".
turn.10: Ray also released "Trouble in town" 7" single in 1984 (Alternative Tentacles Records), featuring "Poisoned heart" and "Trouble in town", with guest vocalists Vince and Steve One.
turn.11: What other aspects of his persona are interesting?
turn.12: The origin of his nickname as 'East Bay Ray' comes from an advertisement sent out for band members which he signed with that name only, leading to the initial lineup of The Dead Kennedys and to his nickname.
